title: Get a building permit with In-House Review
summary: Complete 11-step process for In-House Review building permits. Covers pre-application requirements, plan preparation, submission, review, and issuance. Lists all reviewing agencies and their triggers.
reviewing_agencies: Office of Community Investment and Infrastructure (OCII)

steps.title: Get City Planning zoning approval
steps.description: Many projects require Planning zoning approval PRIOR to building permit submission
key_rules: Planning approval required before building permit submission
OCII areas: receive letter from OCII instead of Planning
Include approval letter from Planning or OCII with building permit application

steps.title: Complete other pre-application requirements
steps.description: Various agency requirements that must be completed before building permit application

sub_requirements.name: Water reuse systems
sub_requirements.trigger: Projects creating 40,000+ sq ft of space
sub_requirements.additional: Onsite water reuse required for 100,000+ sq ft new development

sub_requirements.name: Stormwater Management
sub_requirements.trigger: Creating/replacing 5,000+ sq ft impervious surfaces (combined sewer) or 2,500+ sq ft (separate sewer)

sub_requirements.name: Fire Flow study
sub_requirements.trigger: New construction OR projects adding new floor area to existing buildings
sub_requirements.action: Fire flow study must be included in building permit plans

sub_requirements.name: Water Flow data
sub_requirements.action: Request water flow info from SF Fire records

sub_requirements.name: Public Right of Way Permits
sub_requirements.trigger: Work within public right of way (street/sidewalk, utilities)

sub_requirements.name: Site Assessment and Mitigation (Maher Ordinance)
sub_requirements.trigger: Projects disturbing 50+ cubic yards of soil OR change to sensitive use, in Maher Ordinance area
sub_requirements.maher_areas: Historical industrial uses, areas near freeways, underground storage tanks

sub_requirements.name: Asbestos Remediation
sub_requirements.action: Asbestos report required BEFORE demolition permit application

sub_requirements.name: Valid Address
sub_requirements.action: Confirm property has valid address via SF Property Information Map

steps.title: Decide Full or Site Permit
steps.description: Choose between Full Permit (condensed) or Site Permit (iterative) process

full_permit.description: Condensed process, preferred by most customers
full_permit.initial_submittal: Architectural, Structural, Mechanical/Electrical plans, Title 24 info
full_permit.payments: Two: initial filing fee + issuance fee

site_permit.payments: Minimum four: filing fee, issuance fee, addendum submittal fee, addendum issuance fee
site_permit.process: Addenda submitted after site permit issuance per schedule approved by plan check supervisor

steps.key_rule: Cannot change from Full to Site or vice versa without resubmitting application

steps.title: Prepare to apply
steps.description: Fill out appropriate forms, prepare applicant documentation, Title 24, Green Building, Health requirements, SFPUC water use form
forms_needed: Form 6: Demolition (BAAQMD Job Number required for issuance, per Info Sheet S-04)
also_required: Permit Applicant and Authorized Agent form (must be signed by property owner)
Title 24 Energy forms (per M-03, M-04, M-08; exceptions in M-06)
SFPUC fixture count form (if adding faucets, toilets, plumbing fixtures, or new water service)

steps.title: Format plans
steps.description: Licensed architect/engineer produces construction plans as PDF for electronic plan review (EPR)
key_rules: All plans submitted electronically as PDF
All plan sets must include a Back Check page
Full Permit: full plan set requirements
Site Permit: application requirements + addenda requirements
New residential buildings require acoustical report

sub_requirements.name: Geotechnical report
sub_requirements.trigger: Some projects (hillside properties, safe construction concerns)

sub_requirements.name: Disabled Access checklist
sub_requirements.trigger: Projects in existing commercial buildings or publicly-financed/managed residential buildings

sub_requirements.name: Seismic Safety Tax Exclusion
sub_requirements.trigger: Seismic retrofitting work (submit within 30 days of completing construction)

sub_requirements.name: Water/Power/Sewer checklist
sub_requirements.trigger: New construction or alteration projects (if applicable)

sub_requirements.name: Tree planting and protection
sub_requirements.trigger: New construction or addition of garage, dwelling unit, curb cut, or 500+ sq ft

sub_requirements.name: School fees
sub_requirements.trigger: Calculated by DBI from building permit application info

steps.title: Submit your application
steps.description: Submit online via building permit application portal
key_rules: Properties with active notice of violation routed to DBI Inspections for review

steps.title: Receive confirmation letters
steps.description: Confirmation email + permit application number for tracking

steps.title: Completeness review
key_rules: 3 rounds of incomplete evaluations → escalated to DBI supervisor
Application not reviewed until filing fee is paid

steps.title: Respond to comments
steps.description: City reviews plans for code compliance, applicant responds to comments
key_rules: 3 rounds of comments/revisions → escalated to DBI supervisor
Cal OSHA Industrial Safety Permit may be required for: buildings > 36ft or 3 stories, trenches/excavations 5+ ft deep

steps.title: Obtain your permit
steps.description: After approval, receive documents and pay fees before starting construction
issuance_documents: Sign posting form (if 5+ units and tenants displaced)
key_rules: Full Permit: receive Job Card authorizing construction start
Site Permit: NOT authorized to start — must submit addenda schedule to dbi.ppcrequest@sfgov.org
Separate trade permits (mechanical, electrical, plumbing) may be required
